alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Camden, southwestern Glynn, southeastern Brantley and northeastern Charlton Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Waverly, or 10 miles southeast of Nahunta, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Woodbine, Nahunta, Waverly, Thalmann, Waynesville, Atkinson, Tarboro, Harrietts Bluff, Dover Bluff and Colesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
